Managing mass spectrometry experiments

Source: vignettes/MsExperiment.Rmd
MsExperiment.Rmd

Package: MsExperiment
Authors: Laurent Gatto [aut, cre] (https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1520-2268), Johannes Rainer [aut], Sebastian Gibb [aut]
Last modified: 2021-04-16 19:28:14
Compiled: Fri Apr 16 19:35:07 2021

Introduction

The goal of the MsExperiment package is the store and handle all data related to a mass spectrometry experiment. In this vignette, we will describe how to create a MsExperiment and populate it with various types of data.

library("MsExperiment")

Getting data

We will use a small subset of the PXD022816 project [@Morgenstern:2020]. The acquisitions correspond to the Pierce Thermo HeLa digestion standard, diluted to 50ng/uL with 97:3 + 0.1% formic acid, and acquired on a QExactive instrument.

Below, we use the rpx package to access the project from the PRIDE repository, and download files of interest. Note that these will automatically be cached in the rpx packages’ cache directory.

library("rpx")
px <- PXDataset("PXD022816")
px
## Object of class "PXDataset"
##  Id: PXD022816 with 32 files
##  [1] 'QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzID.gz' ... [32] 'checksum.txt'
##  Use 'pxfiles(.)' to see all files.
pxfiles(px)

The project provides the vendor raw files, the converted mzML files as well as the identification mzid files. Let’s download fractions 1 and 2 of the mzML and mzid files.

If you run these commands interactively and it’s the first time you use pxget(), you will be asked to create the rpx cache directory - you can safelfy answer yes. The files will then be downloaded. Next time you want to get the same files, they will be loaded automatically from cache.

(i <- grep(".+0[12].+[mzML|mzid]", pxfiles(px), value = TRUE))
## [1] "QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzID.gz"
## [2] "QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzML"   
## [3] "QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_02-calib.mzID.gz"
## [4] "QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_02-calib.mzML"
fls <- pxget(px, i)
## Loading QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzID.gz from cache.
## Loading QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzML from cache.
## Loading QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_02-calib.mzID.gz from cache.
## Loading QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_02-calib.mzML from cache.
fls
## [1] "/github/home/.cache/R/rpx/a9825ef1cb9_QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzID.gz"
## [2] "/github/home/.cache/R/rpx/a98625d45d4_QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzML"   
## [3] "/github/home/.cache/R/rpx/a9827e573ab_QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_02-calib.mzID.gz"
## [4] "/github/home/.cache/R/rpx/a98e3400da_QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_02-calib.mzML"

Experiment files

Let’s now start with our MS experiment management by saving the relevant files in a dedicated MsExperimentFiles object. Later, when loading the data, we will refer the the files in this MsExperimentFiles object.

msfls <- MsExperimentFiles(mxmls = grep("mzML", fls, value = TRUE),
                           mzids = grep("mzID", fls, value = TRUE))
msfls
## MsExperimentFiles of length  2 
## [["mxmls"]] a98625d45d4_QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzML ...
## [["mzids"]] a9825ef1cb9_QEP2LC6_HeLa_50ng_251120_01-calib.mzID.gz ...
